intro: Microsechium ruderale, commonly known as the common stinkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Amaranthaceae. It is native to various regions of Africa, including South Africa, and is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. The plant is characterized by its small, inconspicuous flowers and succulent leaves that are sometimes covered in a waxy coating. It is an annual herb that typically grows to a height of about 30 centimeters. Due to its strong odor, it is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
